channel.title: Comments on: Pacific Bowling Center/Dancing Waters Club, 1331 S. Pacific Ave.
channel.description: Blogging demolitions one building at a time.

item.title: By: Yolanda Banda
item.dc:creator: Yolanda Banda
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://www.riplosangeles.com/pacific-bowling-center-dancing-waters-club-1331-south-pacific-avenue-san-pedro-1940/#comment-2">Barbara Andersen</a>.
I was born their and remember seeing Barry. White buying his mom prescription.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Barbara Andersen.

I was born their and remember seeing Barry. White buying his
mom prescription.

item.title: By: Steven Garcia
item.dc:creator: Steven Garcia
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://www.riplosangeles.com/pacific-bowling-center-dancing-waters-club-1331-south-pacific-avenue-san-pedro-1940/#comment-2">Barbara Andersen</a>.
<p>That whole block is featured in 80’s movie “Commando”</p>
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Barbara Andersen.

That whole block is featured in 80’s movie “Commando”

item.title: By: Barbara Andersen
item.dc:creator: Barbara Andersen
item.description: <p>The last building you mentioned at 1309 S Pacific Ave was once LaRue’s Drug Store. It was also seen in many movies, primarily inside shots. I grew up around the corner. Sad, perhaps I have lived too long.</p>
item.content:encoded: The last building you mentioned at 1309 S Pacific Ave was once LaRue’s Drug Store. It was also seen in many movies, primarily inside shots. I grew up around the corner. Sad, perhaps I have lived too long.
